text: Another MESSENGER image Karsh is a crater on Mercury. It has a diameter of 58 kilometers. Its name was suggested by American resident Elizabeth Freeman Rosenzweig in a naming contest which was eventually adopted by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) on 2015. Karsh is named for the Armenian-Canadian photographer Yousuf Karsh. Karsh lies on the west rim of the much larger Rembrandt basin. ==References== Category:Impact craters on Mercury
title: Karsh (crater)
